labels.analysis: The MCP Weather Forecast Server provides real-time weather data through the AccuWeather API, offering hourly forecasts including temperature, humidity, precipitation, and detailed weather conditions. Its core functionality revolves around delivering precise and timely weather information, which can be seamlessly integrated into applications. The available tools suggest its primary use is fetching hourly weather data programmatically.
labels.reasoning: The primary label reflects the server's core purpose of providing weather data. Secondary labels relate to its integration capabilities and data access nature. No custom labels are needed as the predefined categories adequately describe its functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Weather Forecast Server
server_info_crawled.author: @yurthankiyak/mcp-weather
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide accurate hourly weather forecasts and current conditions to enhance your applications with real-time weather data. Access detailed information including temperature, humidity, precipitation probability, and weather descriptions for the next 12 hours. Integrate seamlessly using the AccuWeather API to keep your users informed and prepared.

tools.name: get_hourly_weather
tools.description: Deploy Server Weather Forecast Server @yurthankiyak/mcp-weather Try in Playground get_hourly_weather

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@yurthankiyak/mcp-weather/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
